title: Harry Dunn's parents say "get on" with extraditing US spy's wife as CPS given CCTV
text:

Harry Dunn's parents have called for the speedy extradition of a US spy's wife after CCTV allegedly showing her 'driving on the wrong side of the road' was given to prosecutors.

Police have now reportedly handed their file to the Crown Prosecution Service (CPS), which will decide whether to go forward with a case against Anna Sacoolas.

The US intelligence officer's wife fatally hit motorcyclist Mr Dunn, 19, when driving on the wrong side of the road in Northhamptonshire, it is alleged.

She claimed diplomatic immunity due to her husband's profession and fled to the US.

(Image: SKY NEWS)

However, her immunity is due to expire because her spy partner is no longer in his role, the Daily Mail reports.

If the CPS pushes ahead with the case, an extradition request could be sent to the US.

Radd Seiger, a spokesman for Mr Dunn's parents Charlotte Charles and Tim Dunn, told the paper: "Come on, let's get on with it.

"For us that would be a big step if an extradition request was submitted to the US.

"That would be one giant step towards achieving closure. It's not a game – this family are grieving."

(Image: REUTERS)

US President Donald Trump met Ms Charles and Mr Dunn at the White House last week.

He told them that Sacoolas would not return to the UK, although he offered to introduce the pair to their son's alleged killer.

The parents told Mr Trump that it would be inappropriate to meet Sacoolas, who was reportedly waiting for them in the next room.

The Labour Party has raised concerns about the Foreign Office's handling of Mr Dunn's case, following claims that his parents were not told Sacoolas had left Britain until ten days after her departure.
description: Harry Dunn was allegedly hit by Anna Sacoolas, a US intelligence officer's wife, when she was said to be driving on the wrong side of the road
